hints.content:
Let's start by comparing the highest place value - the ten thousands.

$\greenD{65{,}931}$ and $\blueD{65{,}931}$ both have $6$ ten thousands.  


What is the highest place value where the numbers have different digits?

$\greenD{65{,}931}$ has $5$ thousands. $\blueD{65{,}931}$ also has $5$ thousands.  

$\greenD{65{,}931}$ has $9$ hundreds. $\blueD{65{,}931}$ also has $9$ hundreds.  

$\greenD{65{,}931}$ has $3$ tens. $\blueD{65{,}931}$ also has $3$ tens.  

$\greenD{65{,}931}$ has $1$ one. $\blueD{65{,}931}$ also has $1$ one.
  
Both numbers have the same number of ten thousands, thousands, hundreds, tens, and ones, so they have equal values.

question.content:
